page.title: 05THE COMMUNITY
page.content: Despite the lack of a pub and a school there is a strong community in the village. The major institutions are the Church, the Women's Institute and the Parish Hall, with the Parish Council acting for the local authority. The Church is well supported. Most of the children attend the Sunday School regularly, and congregations include a significent proportion of the population for the major festivals. The Women's Institute meets regularly and runs the annual Flower and Produce show, one of the highlights of the year. The Parish Hall committee organise social and fund-raising events including the children's Christmas party. In traditional village style everyone knows everyone and there is still time, and space, to gossip in the middle of the street.
